byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LIKE robins returning before the snow is well off the ground, the water-colorists begin to flock back to galleries each season as harbingers of Spring. Nearly half of the newly opened shows I saw last week were of work in water-color or gouache, with...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIKE robins returning before the snow is well off the ground, the water-colorists begin to flock back to galleries each season as harbingers of Spring. Nearly half of the newly opened shows I saw last week were of work in water-color or gouache, with old friends and new acquaintances, naturalism and surrealism, traditionalism and innovation all represented.

headline.main: A REVIEWER'S NOTEBOOK: NEW SHOWS; Annual Crop of Water-Colors Begins to Blossom in Galleries -- Brief Comment on Some Recently Opened Attractions

docs.snippet: URUGUAY'S promised series honoring Francisco Acuna de Figueroa (1790-1862) was released on March 18 and copies reached New York last week. The design is his portrait above his name and "El Poeta de Montevideo" (The Poet of Montevideo) and "Autor del...
docs.lead_paragraph: URUGUAY'S promised series honoring Francisco Acuna de Figueroa (1790-1862) was released on March 18 and copies reached New York last week. The design is his portrait above his name and "El Poeta de Montevideo" (The Poet of Montevideo) and "Autor del Himno Nacional" (Author of the National Hymn).

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 6 -- The importance of American solidarity, not only during the war but during the peace that will follow, was stressed by Dr. Ezequiel Padilla, Mexican Foreign Minister, who is on an official visit here, in an address today before...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 6 -- The importance of American solidarity, not only during the war but during the peace that will follow, was stressed by Dr. Ezequiel Padilla, Mexican Foreign Minister, who is on an official visit here, in an address today before the governing board of the Pan American Union.

docs.snippet: The submarine menace to shipping between the United States and South America may be expected "to considerably abate and possibly to disappear during the next few months," and the 1,000,000 tons of Axis shipping which have been acquired by Brazil and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The submarine menace to shipping between the United States and South America may be expected "to considerably abate and possibly to disappear during the next few months," and the 1,000,000 tons of Axis shipping which have been acquired by Brazil and Argentina "ought to be more than suffficient to take care of any shortage of boats," Daniel A. Del Rio, assistant vice president, Central Hanover Bank and Trust Company, declared yesterday.
